overview:
• reconstruction of the geological architecture and the geological history of southeast Victoria;
  • field identification of geological relationships between rock units, including the nature of volcanic eruptions;
  • examination of the Ordovician shale, Permian tillite, Cretaceous and sandstone and Tertiary limestone-deposits; characterisation of the age and environment of these units;
  • introduction to the techniques that are used to evaluate the geomorphic evolution and neotectonics of southeast Australia.
ilo: identify, describe and evaluate simple geological histories in the field; and
read and construct geological cross sections.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: A written report of up to 2000 words
assessment.timing: Four weeks after the completion of field trip

date_times.contact_hours: One six-day field excursion (6 x 7 hours per day), completed either in the first or second half of the teaching period
